AF.content: lawmakers w/out which one can’t have archives, conservation (memory) puts into reserve (“store”), accumulates, capitalizes, stocks a quasi-infinity of layers (hypermnesic, hypomnesic epidermises of books & penises)
AF.linkedContent: lawmakers w/out which one can’t have archives, conservation (memory) puts into reserve (“store”), accumulates, capitalizes, stocks a quasi-infinity of layers (hypermnesic, hypomnesic epidermises of books & penises)

HASD.content: Eckhart: “every creature is full of God and is a book”
HASD.linkedContent: Eckhart: “every creature is full of God and is a book”

POOF.content: Quinet & Michelet: realize Christianity’s dogma (grace) in the Political world, brotherly equality, Fraternity, promise of Christianity: book of the People is yourself, myself (not women though)
POOF.linkedContent: Quinet & Michelet: realize Christianity’s dogma (grace) in the Political world, brotherly equality, Fraternity, promise of Christianity: book of the People is yourself, myself (not women though)

DS.content: true history, history of meaning, as told in Philebus: 1. book is a dialogue or dialectic, our soul resembles a book when we talk to ourselves, a false dialogue, w/out voice, deficient logos [compare to Husserl’s Bedeutung] 2. truth of the book is decidable, the book w/in the soul can be true, psychic writing must appear before tribunal of ontology & dialectics 3. value of the book (true/false) is not intrinsic to it, a span of writing (l’espace écrit) worth nothing in itself, neutral, neither/nor, book as copy, reproduction, of inner speech 4. book as icon, phantasm, soul can be compared to book because each is the image or likeness of the other, logos shaped like eidos, book reproduces logos, specular process > at this point painting plays 2 roles: 1) zōgraphos comes after grammateus, makes portrait of innermost man’s discourse, only worth as much as logos that interprets it 2) painter restores naked image of thing, the image as it presents itself to simple intuition, its intelligible eidos > writer/painter supplement each other w/in tissue of following complicities: 1) both measured against truth 2) they are substitutable images of each other 3) they both partake of mnēmē by dint of participating in mimēsis
DS.linkedContent: true history, history of meaning, as told in Philebus: 1. book is a dialogue or dialectic, our soul resembles a book when we talk to ourselves, a false dialogue, w/out voice, deficient logos [compare to Husserl’s Bedeutung] 2. truth of the book is decidable, the book w/in the soul can be true, psychic writing must appear before tribunal of ontology & dialectics 3. value of the book (true/false) is not intrinsic to it, a span of writing (l’espace écrit) worth nothing in itself, neutral, neither/nor, book as copy, reproduction, of inner speech 4. book as icon, phantasm, soul can be compared to book because each is the image or likeness of the other, logos shaped like eidos, book reproduces logos, specular process > at this point painting plays 2 roles: 1) zōgraphos comes after grammateus, makes portrait of innermost man’s discourse, only worth as much as logos that interprets it 2) painter restores naked image of thing, the image as it presents itself to simple intuition, its intelligible eidos > writer/painter supplement each other w/in tissue of following complicities: 1) both measured against truth 2) they are substitutable images of each other 3) they both partake of mnēmē by dint of participating in mimēsis

DS.content: mime mimes a kind of writing, is himself written in a kind of writing, nothing of what is can lie beyond medium/speculum reading-writing > there is 1) writing w/out book, marking tip (la pointe du trait) proceeds w/out past upon virgin sheet 2) infinite number of booklets in other booklets > Mallarmé reads, writes while reading, while reading text written by Mime, who himself reads in order to write
DS.linkedContent: mime mimes a kind of writing, is himself written in a kind of writing, nothing of what is can lie beyond medium/speculum reading-writing > there is 1) writing w/out book, marking tip (la pointe du trait) proceeds w/out past upon virgin sheet 2) infinite number of booklets in other booklets > Mallarmé reads, writes while reading, while reading text written by Mime, who himself reads in order to write

DS.content: Mallarmé’s book is a block composed of sheets of paper—its “cubic perfection” is open, impossibility of closure, dehiscence as “internal” theater, practice of spacing put in play
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé’s book is a block composed of sheets of paper—its “cubic perfection” is open, impossibility of closure, dehiscence as “internal” theater, practice of spacing put in play

DS.content: hymen, one of those “beneficent figures” engendered by “the opposition btwn the closed and the open”: i.e. the fan, the book, the dancer
DS.linkedContent: hymen, one of those “beneficent figures” engendered by “the opposition btwn the closed and the open”: i.e. the fan, the book, the dancer

DS.content: glassed-in library, open tombs [Nietzsche, Thus Spoke Z…]

POS.content: Derrida’s “books" are entirely consumed by reading of other texts, while also referring only to its own writing: we must conceive these contradictory ideas together [deconstruction of book]
POS.linkedContent: Derrida’s “books" are entirely consumed by reading of other texts, while also referring only to its own writing: we must conceive these contradictory ideas together [deconstruction of book]

POS.content: no end of the book, no beginning of writing, writing puts archie in question
POS.linkedContent: no end of the book, no beginning of writing, writing puts archie in question

PP.content: pharmakon linked to book (biblia), empirical practices, not necessary, writing is open to chance
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon linked to book (biblia), empirical practices, not necessary, writing is open to chance

PP.content: problem of writing linked to problem of “knowing by heart” [speech] > need pharmakon, biblia, if one has not learned speech by heart
PP.linkedContent: problem of writing linked to problem of “knowing by heart” [speech] > need pharmakon, biblia, if one has not learned speech by heart

PP.content: pharmakon is but a formula learned by heart, dead, rigid knowledge shut up (enfermé) in biblia, foreign to living knowledge and dialectic
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon is but a formula learned by heart, dead, rigid knowledge shut up (enfermé) in biblia, foreign to living knowledge and dialectic

ROP.content: edges of book: approach as 1st border (1st pages of a book), end as other border
ROP.linkedContent: edges of book: approach as 1st border (1st pages of a book), end as other border

FS.content: translation of Hegel not finished (thank the Lord!): thus explaining Proust, Joyce, Faulkner > Flaubert feared Hegel, rightfully so; Mallarmé, uniquely, approached Hegel: [why he (alone) knew he couldn’t complete the book?]
FS.linkedContent: translation of Hegel not finished (thank the Lord!): thus explaining Proust, Joyce, Faulkner > Flaubert feared Hegel, rightfully so; Mallarmé, uniquely, approached Hegel: [why he (alone) knew he couldn’t complete the book?]

FS.content: “pure book turns toward Eastern edge of this absence [Blanchot’s pure absence]…is its first and proper content”
FS.linkedContent: “pure book turns toward Eastern edge of this absence [Blanchot’s pure absence]…is its first and proper content”

FS.content: pure book must be about nothing (Flaubert, Artaud)
FS.linkedContent: pure book must be about nothing (Flaubert, Artaud)

FS.content: God of Leibniz does not know the anguish of choice, only one book distributed through all books, God’s Will always chooses the “best”
FS.linkedContent: God of Leibniz does not know the anguish of choice, only one book distributed through all books, God’s Will always chooses the “best”

FS.content: for Leibniz, no tragedy of the book, only one Book, this same Book is distributed throughout all books [cf. Theodicy pp. 375-78]
FS.linkedContent: for Leibniz, no tragedy of the book, only one Book, this same Book is distributed throughout all books [cf. Theodicy pp. 375-78]

FS.content: writing, not a determined pathos, an empirical state of writer, but responsibility of angustia: [Derrida is privileging a power of equivocality over creativity of classical God, anguish connoting a narrowing, a loss of breath, a restriction, constraint, and thus the anguish of choice]
FS.linkedContent: writing, not a determined pathos, an empirical state of writer, but responsibility of angustia: [Derrida is privileging a power of equivocality over creativity of classical God, anguish connoting a narrowing, a loss of breath, a restriction, constraint, and thus the anguish of choice]

FS.content: to write: 1) not only to conceive Leibnizian book as an impossible possibility (as Mallarmé names the limit) 2) ce n'est pas seulement savoir que le Livre n'existe pas et qu'à jamais il y a des livres où (se) brise, avant même d'avoir été un, le sens d'un monde impensé par un sujet absolu [the English translation of this sentence fails to capture the sense of the books themselves shattering] 3) nor is it to have lost the certainty of pages binding themselves into a “book of reason” 4) not only to know that the non-written can’t be relegated to having no basis by the obliging negativity of some dialectic 5) not only to know that through writing the best may not transpire 6) it is the impossibility of making meaning precede writing: it is to lower meaning while elevating inscription
FS.linkedContent: to write: 1) not only to conceive Leibnizian book as an impossible possibility (as Mallarmé names the limit) 2) ce n'est pas seulement savoir que le Livre n'existe pas et qu'à jamais il y a des livres où (se) brise, avant même d'avoir été un, le sens d'un monde impensé par un sujet absolu [the English translation of this sentence fails to capture the sense of the books themselves shattering] 3) nor is it to have lost the certainty of pages binding themselves into a “book of reason” 4) not only to know that the non-written can’t be relegated to having no basis by the obliging negativity of some dialectic 5) not only to know that through writing the best may not transpire 6) it is the impossibility of making meaning precede writing: it is to lower meaning while elevating inscription

FS.content: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics
FS.linkedContent: absence & haunting of divine sign (Jewish God) [cf. GOD], anguish of Hebraic ruah (pneuma), regulates modern books/criticism/aesthetics

FS.content: structuralist reading > presupposes/appeals to theological simultaneity of the book
FS.linkedContent: structuralist reading > presupposes/appeals to theological simultaneity of the book

FS.content: Mallarmé unrealized unity of Book by making conceptual categories securing it tremble
FS.linkedContent: Mallarmé unrealized unity of Book by making conceptual categories securing it tremble

O.content: time as time of preface, space as space of preface > preface: entire location & duration of book
O.linkedContent: time as time of preface, space as space of preface > preface: entire location & duration of book

O.content: Kierkegaard: blank spaces, voids btwn books, empty expanse btwn Teutons > write what you will
O.linkedContent: Kierkegaard: blank spaces, voids btwn books, empty expanse btwn Teutons > write what you will

O.content: the 2 fictions: 1) when fiction is in service of meaning, truth is (truth of) fiction, it is low on a hierarchy, accessory to concept 2) fiction outside mimetologism affirms itself as simulacrum, disorganizes all oppositions to which teleology of book sought to violently subordinate it
O.linkedContent: the 2 fictions: 1) when fiction is in service of meaning, truth is (truth of) fiction, it is low on a hierarchy, accessory to concept 2) fiction outside mimetologism affirms itself as simulacrum, disorganizes all oppositions to which teleology of book sought to violently subordinate it

O.content: book as Logos, Model, nature, book of life, absolute adequation of presence
O.linkedContent: book as Logos, Model, nature, book of life, absolute adequation of presence

O.content: preface’s (double inscription’s) semantic envelopment in Book (representative of ontotheology, absolute knowledge) > restance (left-overness) of its textual exteriority should not be confused w/ Book’s physical thickness
O.linkedContent: preface’s (double inscription’s) semantic envelopment in Book (representative of ontotheology, absolute knowledge) > restance (left-overness) of its textual exteriority should not be confused w/ Book’s physical thickness

O.content: MOP as effacement or sublimation of seminal differance, restance of outwork gets internalized, domesticated into ontotheology of great book
O.linkedContent: MOP as effacement or sublimation of seminal differance, restance of outwork gets internalized, domesticated into ontotheology of great book

O.content: acc. Claudel, all finite books opuscules of great divine opus
O.linkedContent: acc. Claudel, all finite books opuscules of great divine opus

O.content: if nature is the book, how could there be both, don’t we have to decide btwn is and and, or find a mute conjunction to think book/nature together (cum) as set?
O.linkedContent: if nature is the book, how could there be both, don’t we have to decide btwn is and and, or find a mute conjunction to think book/nature together (cum) as set?

O.content: sense of fulfillment by way of copula (is) means nature is incomplete, needs a book to complete itself: closure of library articulates itself and turns on this hinge (gond): logic, rather graphics, of supplement
O.linkedContent: sense of fulfillment by way of copula (is) means nature is incomplete, needs a book to complete itself: closure of library articulates itself and turns on this hinge (gond): logic, rather graphics, of supplement

O.content: adventurous excess of writing not improv., throw of dice doesn’t contradict rigorous necessity of its “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus) [literature or book: atheistic face of this play, conflagration achieved, final clause located sur la tranche du livre fermé]
O.linkedContent: adventurous excess of writing not improv., throw of dice doesn’t contradict rigorous necessity of its “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus) [literature or book: atheistic face of this play, conflagration achieved, final clause located sur la tranche du livre fermé]

O.content: Mallarmé: lift a corner of the veil, fragment of total book—scintillate (the whole that’ll never be)
O.linkedContent: Mallarmé: lift a corner of the veil, fragment of total book—scintillate (the whole that’ll never be)

O.content: beneath form of its protocolic block, preface is everywhere, it’s bigger than the book
O.linkedContent: beneath form of its protocolic block, preface is everywhere, it’s bigger than the book

O.content: if you wanna see for yourself, encounter by chance, enmeshed (engrenés) in some corner (coin), ce qui’l en est de la coupe or/livre
O.linkedContent: if you wanna see for yourself, encounter by chance, enmeshed (engrenés) in some corner (coin), ce qui’l en est de la coupe or/livre

RGE.content: absurd for transgression of Book by writing to be legible only in a determined sense
RGE.linkedContent: absurd for transgression of Book by writing to be legible only in a determined sense

EJQB.content: book is never finite, tout devra habiter le livre (everything enters into, passes through, transpires in the book) [nothing outside the text], remains suffering and vigilant (veilleuse)
EJQB.linkedContent: book is never finite, tout devra habiter le livre (everything enters into, passes through, transpires in the book) [nothing outside the text], remains suffering and vigilant (veilleuse)

EJQB.content: to be is to-be-in-the-book (être-dans-le-livre), book only threatened by nothing, if it came to be, the threat, it would be of the house and of the book
EJQB.linkedContent: to be is to-be-in-the-book (être-dans-le-livre), book only threatened by nothing, if it came to be, the threat, it would be of the house and of the book

EJQB.content: question w/in unity of book welcomes all contradictions, affirmations, questions > a logic like no other
EJQB.linkedContent: question w/in unity of book welcomes all contradictions, affirmations, questions > a logic like no other

EJQB.content: Jabès knows the book is possessed & threatened
EJQB.linkedContent: Jabès knows the book is possessed & threatened

EJQB.content: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord
EJQB.linkedContent: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord

EJQB.content: the Book as epoch of Being (epoch coming to an end, the glow of Being in agony, a multiplication of the end, “garrulous and tenacious hypermnesia of certain moribunds,” books about the dead book)
EJQB.linkedContent: the Book as epoch of Being (epoch coming to an end, the glow of Being in agony, a multiplication of the end, “garrulous and tenacious hypermnesia of certain moribunds,” books about the dead book)

EJQB.content: Being radically outside book, its letter? > Being reveals itself only in illegibility (illisibilité)?
EJQB.linkedContent: Being radically outside book, its letter? > Being reveals itself only in illegibility (illisibilité)?

EJQB.content: radical illisibilité belongs to the book, very possibility of it > such illegibility not an accomplice of lost (sought after) legibility, of a page not yet cut from divine encyclopedia
EJQB.linkedContent: radical illisibilité belongs to the book, very possibility of it > such illegibility not an accomplice of lost (sought after) legibility, of a page not yet cut from divine encyclopedia

EJQB.content: books are always books of life, or of afterlife > written questions addressed to literature are forgotten, drained, by literature (mortifications, ruses of life, life negating itself in literature to survive): writing would die of pure vigilance to question (and also simple erasure of question)
EJQB.linkedContent: books are always books of life, or of afterlife > written questions addressed to literature are forgotten, drained, by literature (mortifications, ruses of life, life negating itself in literature to survive): writing would die of pure vigilance to question (and also simple erasure of question)

EJQB.content: absolute interrogation (of God) will never belong to the book
EJQB.linkedContent: absolute interrogation (of God) will never belong to the book

CIN.content: [on structure of CIN] graphic space opened to multiple readings—in traditional, protected form of book
CIN.linkedContent: [on structure of CIN] graphic space opened to multiple readings—in traditional, protected form of book

CIN.content: each time it gives a different reading, another gift, dealing out a new hand all over again
CIN.linkedContent: each time it gives a different reading, another gift, dealing out a new hand all over again

OG.content: death of book announces death of full speech, announces exhaustion of language’s archon [speech], as if language now seen as a species of writing, as a (short) 3000 year adventure: announces new mutation in history of writing
OG.linkedContent: death of book announces death of full speech, announces exhaustion of language’s archon [speech], as if language now seen as a species of writing, as a (short) 3000 year adventure: announces new mutation in history of writing

OG.content: writing as metaphoricity itself: a simulated immediacy; w/in logocentrism: bad writing is finite, artificial, sensible; good writing is infinite, soul-writing, Book of God (natural)
OG.linkedContent: writing as metaphoricity itself: a simulated immediacy; w/in logocentrism: bad writing is finite, artificial, sensible; good writing is infinite, soul-writing, Book of God (natural)

OG.content: Rousseau: to “judge genius” from books is like “painting a man’s portrait from his corpse”; Derrida: writing in the common sense is the dead letter, exhausts life, carrier of death
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: to “judge genius” from books is like “painting a man’s portrait from his corpse”; Derrida: writing in the common sense is the dead letter, exhausts life, carrier of death

OG.content: book as idea of totality, encyclopedia, requires external signified, is against writing and its aphoristic energy
OG.linkedContent: book as idea of totality, encyclopedia, requires external signified, is against writing and its aphoristic energy

OG.content: violence on both sides: logocentrism (book), deconstruction (text)

though [eschatological] Hegel reappropriates trace in absolute knowledge, he is also the thinker of irreducible difference, last writer of book, first of writing > reintroduced necessity of written trace in philosophy, rehabilitated thought as the memory productive of signs
OG.linkedContent: though [eschatological] Hegel reappropriates trace in absolute knowledge, he is also the thinker of irreducible difference, last writer of book, first of writing > reintroduced necessity of written trace in philosophy, rehabilitated thought as the memory productive of signs

OG.content: André Leroi-Gourhan’s vision of a vast ‘tape-library’ w/ an electronic selection system, beyond the book, beyond the linear [:)] [baby daddy]
OG.linkedContent: André Leroi-Gourhan’s vision of a vast ‘tape-library’ w/ an electronic selection system, beyond the book, beyond the linear [:)] [baby daddy]

OG.content: end of linear writing (epic model) is end of the book: “because we are beginning to write, to write differently, we must reread differently”
OG.linkedContent: end of linear writing (epic model) is end of the book: “because we are beginning to write, to write differently, we must reread differently”

OG.content: Rousseau & Lévi-Strauss on books piling, filled w/ lies; book of nature: look, don’t read
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau & Lévi-Strauss on books piling, filled w/ lies; book of nature: look, don’t read

EU.content: [re: use of word “translation” to refer to “transposition, transfer, transport” in a sense not strictly linguistic] for Schelling, language is a living phenomenon; Novalis, Goethe: nature an author to be translated w/ skill of a philologist
EU.linkedContent: [re: use of word “translation” to refer to “transposition, transfer, transport” in a sense not strictly linguistic] for Schelling, language is a living phenomenon; Novalis, Goethe: nature an author to be translated w/ skill of a philologist

EU.content: Schelling: “nature is like some very ancient author whose message is written in hieroglyphics on colossal pages” [geologic?]
EU.linkedContent: Schelling: “nature is like some very ancient author whose message is written in hieroglyphics on colossal pages” [geologic?]

FV.content: “in” a library, in books, everything begins, thus nothing begins, only dérive, disorientation—from which one does not emerge [nothing outside text]
FV.linkedContent: “in” a library, in books, everything begins, thus nothing begins, only dérive, disorientation—from which one does not emerge [nothing outside text]
